fields.description:
h3. Summary
When attempting to insert a bullet or numbered list inside a macro, such as [Info, Tip, Note, or Warning Macros|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/info-tip-note-and-warning-macros-51872369.html], which itself is inside a bullet or numbered list, the bullet/number will not display, yet the toolbar button is still selected, showing it is enabled:

 !Screen Shot 2017-11-29 at 2.50.14 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
Confluence Server, tested with versions 5.9.8, 6.4.0, 6.4.1, as of the writing of this bug.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page.
# Insert Bullet List or Numbered List, either using markup, the toolbar buttons, or the shortcut.
# Insert a panel/warning/note/info macro right under the first item in the list.
# Attempt to insert another Bullet or Numbered list inside of the macro.

(i) Refer to  [^error.mp4] for detailed information.

h3. Expected Results
The bullet or numbered macro is expected to continue to display within the macro.

h3. Actual Results
The original formatting is broken, and the numbered or bullet list does not display. The button on the toolbar remains selected as if it were being inserted.

h3.Workaround
Two options:
* Toggle the button for bullet or numbered list off/on and the list will be inserted.
* Create the bullet or numbered list outside of the macro and manually paste it into the macro.
fields.summary: Bullet or Numbered List Breaks Formatting Within a Macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Attempting to subscribe to Team Calendar link in Google Calendar returns error:
 "Settings Error - We could not parse the calendar at the url requested."

Subscribing to the same url in other clients Apple Calendar and Outlook works without error.
h3. Environment
 * Team Calendar v. 5.3.19, 5.3.20

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Following the steps to generate the calendar subscription url in Confluence calendar *. . . > Subscribe*
 # Then in Google Calendar, attempt to add the calendar by subscription url (see: [Subscribe to and from Team Calendars|https://confluence.atlassian.com/teamcal/subscribe-to-and-from-team-calendars-273285883.html])
 # Google Calendar appears to begin to start but then displays the error.  



h3. Expected Results

Calendar subscription should be added successfully
h3. Actual Results

Google displays the error.

"Settings Error
 We could not parse the calendar at the url requested."

UPDATE: In recent Google Calendar design update, it looks like no error is displayed but no success message is reported and no calendar items are imported on the calendar.

UPDATE: We have also found that office365 calendars experience the same issues. The calendar can be added with no error message, but no calendar items are imported on the calendar.
h3. Notes

In trying to investigate the source of the error, I've downloaded the .ics files and tried checking them for errors with some [online ICS file format validator|https://icalendar.org/validator.html] which gave errors on the VTIMEZONE data. For troubleshooting, we asked the customer to try alternative timezones as they also ran into other issues with the "Hong Kong" timezone in other another bug (CONFSERVER-48595 / --CONFSERVER-48981--) but they still experienced the errors on both of their calendars.

As additional troubleshooting, I downloaded the .ics files from the calendar subscription urls and tried instead to just import them and received similar errors. If I manually edited the ICS files to remove the whole *VTIMEZONE* content, I was able to import the calendar data into a temp calendar for testing. I tried just removing only bits of the VTIMEZONE data but still ran into issues until I removed everything in between and including:
{code:none}
BEGIN:VTIMEZONE
END:VTIMEZONE
{code}
h3. Workaround

There is no known workaround currently available for Google Calendars.

Subscribing still seems to work with [other Calendar applications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/teamcal/subscribe-to-and-from-team-calendars-273285883.html] such as Microsoft Outlook, Apple Mac Calendar, and Apple iOS Calendar.
fields.summary: Team Calendar subscription does not work in Google Calendar, but does in Apple Mac Calendar and Outlook

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When triple-clicking to highlight a section of text and then deleting it, the following header/paragraph loses its heading type.

h3. Environment
Chrome browser

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page with two paragraphs followed by a heading (or preformatted text)
# In the edit window, delete the paragraph before the heading by [triple-clicking|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Triple-click] and the typing Backspace or Delete

h3. Expected Results
The highlighted paragraph is deleted

h3. Actual Results
The highlighted paragraph is deleted, but the following headed is changed to the default *Paragraph* format

h3. Notes
This issue does not occur in Safair nor Firefox

h3.Workaround
# Do not utilize the triple click
# Utilize another browser
fields.summary: Deleting paragraph before heading, loses heading format in Chrome

fields.description:
We need the ability to review other people's changes before I publish my changes in case there's some changes that someone else has done that isn't ready for publishing. 

This is a show stopper for us. This should be related to CONFSERVER-53679 which I also suggested to have done and probably should be worked together.

We feel it's first important for people to understand what other changes were made from other people prior to one publishing their own changes in case they need to wait till everyone is satisfied. But if we can also allow people to just publish their own changes, that would be even better so people don't have to wait till everyone is satisfied with all the other changes before publishing. In addition as I'm waiting for others to finalize their changes, that doesn't mean some other people won't jump in and edit the document which means more people to wait on.
fields.summary: As a user of Collaborative Editing, I want the ability to review other people's changes before I publish my changes in case there's some changes that someone else has done that isn't ready for publishing

fields.description:
As a user of Collaborative Editing, I want the ability to publish my own changes and have the option to not include other people's changes in draft so I don't publish draft changes that aren't ready.

This is a very important feature as we don't want to publish things that people might not be completely finished with especially if it's critical information to the business. 

This is a show stopper for upgrading Confluence to 6.4+ from 5.10. We could upgrade but we wouldn't enable Collaborative Editing but we feel then there's no purpose to upgrade.
fields.summary: As a user of Collaborative Editing, I want the ability to publish my own changes and have the option to not include other people's changes in draft so I don't publish draft changes that aren't ready

fields.description:
Hello,

Confluence database schema contains the quite useful table called *AO_92296B_AORECENTLY_VIEWED*. This table contains data about recently viewed pages and we use a set of scripted MySQL queries to get statistics.

Unfortunately, the data in the table is not a pure views history and the distinctions as below:
* Records in this table are stored only for the last 2 months.
* I assumed it just added records to the table each time someone hit a page. Rather it looks like it will add a page hit record if the content_id and user_key combination is unique. If there is already a row for content_id and user_key it will simply update that row.

So, my suggestion is to add a new table into database which will store the same data as AO_92296B_AORECENTLY_VIEWED does but for a longer period (make it configurable via the WebGUI) and views records will be always added instead of updating existing records.
fields.summary: Add views history table into database

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The "chown -R -H confluence:confluence /media/atl/confluence/shared-home" that runs when a new node is brought online before the application starts takes a large amount of time.
h3. Suggested Solution

Either remove this step or create a flag file on the EFS shared storage to indicate this has been executed.  Any permissions issues beyond this point is likely user error.
h3. Workaround

Wait for the process to run on new nodes.  This currently adds 15 minutes to our startup time when scaling.
fields.summary: Update CloudFormation deployment to not chown on every startup

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When a friendly DNS name is used outside of Route53, Syncrhony/Collaboration fails to operate.  We are not able to use Route53 for our external DNS.  I am guessing that the failure is due to the SSL certificate is not valid for the ELB DNS, which is what the CloudFormation template defaults to for all the URL configurations. 
h3. Suggested Solution

Update the template to include a supported a field for the URL that could be used when needed.  I understand that you would need to manually create a cname that points to the ELB outside of this process, but at least with the option in the template it would be possible without having to make modifications to the template.
h3. Workaround

The only workarounds are to either modify the official template to change the URL or to manually logon to hosts as they spin up and modify the various configuration files.  The issue with the second workaround is that when the ASG spins up new nodes, they will fail until that step has been completed.
fields.summary: Update CloudFormation Template to allow non-Route53 DNS

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently the CloudFormation Template uses the EFS DNS name to mount the filesystem via the fstab.  However, using the Amazon DNS is not always an option, such as in our case.  The result is that the EFS filesystem fails to mount. 
h3. Suggested Solution

Update the CloudFormation Template to mount the EFS using the IP. 
h3. Workaround

There are two options here.  One is to logon to each new host as the ASG spins up and manually mount the file system and correct all the issues related to it not being mounted on boot (not sure what they all are) or modify the template. 

In order to resolve the issue, I wrapped a dig lookup around the existing code.  There probably is a more efficient method to do this, but it was quick and easy and resolved the issue I was encountering.
 - - $(dig +short @169.254.169.253 $(curl -s [http://169.254.169.254/latest/meta-data/placement/availability-zone).$\|http://169.254.169.254/latest/meta-data/placement/availability-zone).$]\{ElasticFileSystem}".efs."$\{Region}".amazonaws.com")
fields.summary: Update CloudFormation Template to use EFS IP in fstab mount

fields.description:
h4. Behavior
The shared-home folder contains 2 other folders called "dcl-document", "dcl-thumbnail" and "dcl-document_hd" that increase in size as we add new office files to Confluence pages and generate thumbnails for them.

h4. Test
The problem is that companies that heavily rely on office files attached to pages can reach GB in some time depending on the number of files and size of each one.

For example:
1) A XLS office file with 1 row only, when attached to a page, generate a 18kb thumbnail file.
2) A XLS office sample file with about 50k rows and 6MB generate a 18MB thumbnail file.

A office file that contains a graphic can also generate different thumbnail sizes.

It would be good to deploy a cleanup for this folder or improve the thumbnail size.

h4. Workaround
1) You can delete all contents of the "dcl-document", "dcl-thumbnail" and "dcl-document_hd", or generate a script to automate the deletion from time to time.

2) You can disable the "Confluence View File Macro" in manage Add ons. This one has a drawback of disabling all view file macros for the office files and images in Confluence, but won't generate the files in the shared home folder anymore.
3) Old Confluence backup can also be deleted from shared home folder.
fields.summary: Shared home folder increasing in size due to office thumbnails

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
We closed this ticket because:
 * It is too generic since there are different sources that could generate the same WARN messages.
 * These WARN messages are mostly harmless and misleading on AWS because it currently returns a new a rotating cookie key to the client for every request and *the sticky session is not lost*.
 * We have also verified that Confluence Data Center has been working properly behind an Nginx Plus Load Balancer with session affinity enabled.

For any specific case, we will open a new ticket to address it, such as CONFSERVER-56254. Please don't reference to this ticket but raise a new one if you can narrow down to which use case that causes the sticky session to be lost and the user is asked to log in again.
{panel}
h3. Summary

When using a load balancer, firewall or application that sets cookies with an {{expires}} attribute (not {{Max-Age}}) in a Cookie header, Confluence throws a WARN (in this example it's trying to get the data from a Jira User Server via the firewall)
{code:java}
2017-10-04 16:31:55,549 WARN [http-nio-8443-exec-45] [http.client.protocol.ResponseProcessCookies] processCookies Invalid cookie header: "Set-Cookie: this_is_a_cookie=AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA; e
xpires=Thu, 04 Oct 2018 12:31:45 GMT; path=/; Domain=.mycompany.com". Invalid 'expires' attribute: Thu, 04 Oct 2018 12:31:45 GMT
-- referer: https://confluence.mycompany.com/plugins/servlet/embedded-crowd/configure/jira/ | url: /plugins/servlet/embedded-crowd/configure/jira/ | traceId: 905ff3f698dd7782 | userName: username@mycompany.com
{code}
h3. Environment
 * External firewall or loadbalancer that Confluence is connecting through

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up a load balancer or firewall that sets cookies with an *expires* element on the {{Cookie:}} header
 # Have Confluence pull content via load balancer

h3. Expected Results

Link is parsed without error
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the {{atlassian-confluence.log}} file:
{noformat}
2017-10-04 16:31:55,549 WARN [http-nio-8443-exec-45] [http.client.protocol.ResponseProcessCookies] processCookies Invalid cookie header: "Set-Cookie: this_is_a_cookie=AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA; e
xpires=Thu, 04 Oct 2018 12:31:45 GMT; path=/; Domain=.mycompany.com". Invalid 'expires' attribute: Thu, 04 Oct 2018 12:31:45 GMT
-- referer: https://confluence.mycompany.com/plugins/servlet/embedded-crowd/configure/jira/ | url: /plugins/servlet/embedded-crowd/configure/jira/ | traceId: 905ff3f698dd7782 | userName: username@mycompany.com
{noformat}
h3. Notes

This can be reproduced with Amazon ALB.
h3. Workaround

Bypass the firewall or load balancer, or make sure the external application does not return cookies with {{expires}} attribute.
fields.summary: HTTP Client in Confluence does not accept RFC6265 compliant date format in "Expires" cookie header

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
If a customer wants to use custom Javascript (JS) in their Confluence instance they can:
# Place files into the <confluence-install>/includes/js which provides them with a url like <base-url>/includes/js/<filename>.js to use as the file source
#* The steps are laid out in [How to use JavaScript in Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-use-javascript-in-confluence-313458839.html]
#* As of Confluence 5.8 (see [CONFSERVER-39799|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-39799]) this now has a 20 second load time. This is caused by requests to those URLs kicking off an {{ESIndexJournalVerifierJob}} task that takes around 20 seconds to complete
# Include the entirety of their JS code into the {{At the end of the Head}} section of Custom HTML admin panel
# Write a plugin for Confluence that provides the JS they need through [Web Resource Module - Atlassian Developers|https://developer.atlassian.com/confdev/confluence-plugin-guide/confluence-plugin-module-types/web-resource-module]

h3. Suggested Solution
Either engineer this {{ESIndexJournalVerifierJob}} to take into account custom JS files getting called via the /includes/js path, or provide a method for customers to load custom JS without having to write a plugin, use the Custom HTML method, or have these indexing jobs kick off.
 
h3. Workaround 
* Put the entire JS code into the Admin > Custom HTML > At end of the Head
fields.summary: Provide an approved method to load custom Javascript files

fields.description:
It appears that the Activity Stream gadget shows a Stream for each Application Link that is defined in the system, and each of these Streams are selected by default when adding a new Activity Stream gadget.

Given the performance overhead of traversing each Application Link to determine if any updates are available, the default settings should just have the hosting Confluence instance's Stream selected by default.

This will save in performance and also improve user experience. In our case, we have to click on 10+ checkboxes to deselect them each time we add this gadget.
fields.summary: Activity Stream should not include all streams by default
Support MySQL Databases using utf8mb4

fields.description:
Hello,

I have a feature request for How- To Article blueprint. 
h2. Description

The ability to edit 'Content by label' macro in the How- To Article blueprint to have certain label in the search criteria addition to the user input.
h2. Problem

If I have a huge space that I add a How- To Article to, 'Content by label' will search from everything in that space. For example like having a label 'password'. Knowing that there are many wiki articles containing the label password would mean I would have a lot of pages show up in the Related section in 'Content by label' macro, even though they are not relevant for the topic.
h2. Solution

A simple solution to this would be that the 'content by label' macro would have the "kb-how-to-article" label in it with the one that user inputs, so that the Content by label macro would only search from the How- To Articles instead of the whole space, and for those who would like to opt out of this just have the old method available.

Extensive solution for this would be the ability to completely edit the 'Content by Label' macro in the blueprints.
fields.summary: The ability to edit 'Content by label' macro in the How- To Article blueprint

h3. Summary
When downloading tar.gz files from our Confluence Download Archive via the Firefox Web Browser the files are not able to be properly unzipped via the command line without unzipping twice. Issue does not occur with wget downloads.

h3. Environment
Firefox

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open Firefox and Download one of the below Confluence versions from our [archive|https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/download-archives] does not have a valid tar.gz:
||OS||Browser||Version||Valid tar.gz?||
|Windows|Firefox|6.4.1|(x)|
|Windows|Firefox|6.3.1|(x)|
|Windows|Firefox|6.2.4|(x)|
|Windows|Firefox|6.0.7|(x)|
|Windows|Chrome|6.0.7|(/)|
|Windows|Chrome|6.2.4|(/)|
|Windows|Chrome|6.3.1|(/)|
|Windows|Firefox|6.0.3|(x)|
|Windows|Chrome|6.0.3|(/)|

h3. Expected Results
The file is downloaded and expandable via the terminal

h3. Actual Results

h3. +Summary+

Users can't use Universal Plugin Manager to download / install add-ons.
h3. +Steps to reproduce+
 # Navigate to Manage add-ons page - /plugins/servlet/upm/marketplace/
 # Try to install any add-on

h3. +Observed problem+

!image.png|thumbnail!
h3. +Cause+

 This issue is caused by a temporary domain name change for Marketplace add-ons. If your firewall rules only allow connections to marketplace.atlassian.com and marketplace-cdn.atlassian.com, you would be affected by this.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
For a PPTX file that had been attached to a page using the Attachments macro, when you open the file via the "View button", the loading icon spins interminably.  

h3. Environment
This error occurred both in Linux environment as well as in a local Mac environment using 6.2.4.   When tested with 5.10.8, the same behavior in the UI resulted.  However, no error in the log was recorded.

A sample of the PPTX file in question is located in the comments section.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Attach the sample PPTX file to a page using the Attachment macro.
# Open the file using the Open button

h3. Expected Results
# The file should open

h3. Actual Results
The file loading spinning icon displays interminably.  Within the application log files, the following error is generated:
{code}
2017-08-29 15:39:32,753 ERROR [DefaultSlideCacheManager:thread-2] [com.benryan.conversion.AbstractSlideConversionTask] call problem while converting capacity planning for application servers - there was a problem converting this attachment  tried at 11 57 am.pptx
 -- referer: http://localhost:9624/conf/pages/worddav/preview.action?fileName=Capacity+Planning+for+Application+Servers+-+There+was+a+problem+converting+this+attachment++Tried+at+11+57+AM.pptx&pageId=327693 | url: /conf/plugins/servlet/pptslide | traceId: 165fb350cc0fd61f | userName: charlie
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.benryan.pptx.record.AbstractSingleShape.getAnchor(AbstractSingleShape.java:81)
	at com.benryan.pptx.record.AbstractSingleShape.getAnchor(AbstractSingleShape.java:32)
	at com.benryan.escher.EscherRenderer.walkShapes(EscherRenderer.java:177)
	at com.benryan.ppt.PptRenderer.render(PptRenderer.java:123)
{code}
Please note the reference to the getAnchor method in the stack trace.

h3.Workaround
# Open the file using the Preview button.
# Upload using the [View File Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf613/view-file-macro-964960939.html]:
## Edit the page 
## Drag the .pptx to the edit window
##* Confluence will upload the attachment and embed it using the viewfile macro 
## Save the page 
# Issue was not reproducible in 7.0.X
fields.summary: View PPTX file via Attachments macro renders NPE and references getAnchor method

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Attempts to send a curl with head request (curl -I) always results in a 500 error

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make the following request:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
curl -I http://<base-url>/synchrony-proxy/heartbeat
{code}

h3. Expected Results
Receive a 200 response, with a full listing of headers received.

h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
HTTP/1.1 500 Internal Server Error
Server: Apache-Coyote/1.1
Date: Mon, 02 Oct 2017 16:28:39 GMT
Access-Control-Allow-Origin: *
Access-Control-Allow-Headers: content-type, accept, x-token, x-atlassian-mau-ignore
Access-Control-Allow-Methods: GET, PUT, POST, OPTIONS
Access-Control-Max-Age: 86400
Content-Type: application/json;charset=UTF-8
Content-Length: 65
Connection: close
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes

fields.description:
In Confluence, all the pages that the user has recently edited/contributed will be displayed on the "Recently Worked on" session. This session will also include the drafts for unpublished pages. In specific situations, the user might want to come back to a draft that the same was working previously, but, it will take time for the user to find the draft on the list of the recently worked pages. 

To speed up the process and help the users, this is a suggestion to include the user drafts page in a new session (for example, instead of being included on the "Recently Worked on", it would be a new session from the sidebar, called "Drafts") or/and a sub-session for the "Recently Worked on" page so the user can directly access it.
fields.summary: Include Draft Page into "Recently Worked On" Dashboard

fields.description:
h1. Problem

You can hide elements from anonymous users via JavaScript, but this usually introduces some flicker on the screen, since the code has to wait for *AJS* to initialize. That is, the elements you're hiding will be visible for a fraction of a second (or longer) before the JavaScript code kicks in and removes the elements from view. Hiding elements via custom CSS in a global or space-specific stylesheet does not seem to introduce any flicker, but you cannot target only anonymous users with CSS.

*Note!* The use case here is, of course, broader than just hiding elements from anonymous users. This applies to any case where you need to provide different content to anonymous and logged-in users, and want to avoid flicker.
h1. Solution

Make it possible to use a CSS selector to target users depending on whether they are anonymous or logged-in. I think it would basically be enough to add a dedicated *class* or *attribute* to the *<body>* element of a Confluence page to track the user's login state. You could then use a *class* or *attribute selector* to check the login state.
h1. Open issues
 * Is it technically possible to add the class or attribute early enough in the page loading process to avoid flicker, that is, before the custom CSS is processed?
 * Is the CSS attribute selector sufficiently supported across different browsers and browser versions? Would a class actually be the better option?
 * Are there security issues related to exposing the login state in the page HTML code?
 * Does the proposed solution break the logic or philosophy of CSS? Do we care?
fields.summary: Detect via CSS whether the user is anonymous or logged-in

fields.description:
We currently are on version 5.7 and working on upgrading to 6.3. What has been noted is that when a user makes multiple changes to the same document over the course of a day or more, it's difficult to see what has been changed so we'd like to propose some updates to Confluence if they don't already exist.
 * On the Show History page, allow the user to see and select all changes by Date (all changes made today, last week, etc.) and/or by user.
 * After selecting versions and clicking Compare, display a sidebar that allows the user to:
 * > Display only the changes
 * > Navigate to the changes

As an a side, when watching a page,I get an email that shows the entire document but no indication of what was changed. It would be helpful if you could highlight the changed text.
fields.summary: Page History: Ability to compare multiple versions and quickly see differences

fields.description:
h4. Suggestion Summary
Currently, when an user runs into an issue related to a invalid date/time entry in a Confluence page, instead of showing a friendly message, the application will display an error log.

h4. Stack Trace
{code}
2017-09-27 10:24:39,069 ERROR [http-nio-8090-exec-23] [confluence.content.service.RenderContentCommandImpl] validateInternal Error generating preview.
-- referer: https://confluence.host.com/pages/resumedraft.action?draftId=12345&draftShareId=usuihsd-123sjhdas-31232 | url: /pages/rendercontent.action | traceId: 66441c0e06667035 | userName: user | action: rendercontent
com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.XhtmlException: RuntimeException occurred while transforming editor format to storage format (com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.XhtmlException: An error occurred due to invalid date time format during unmarshalling a time from storage format.)
{code}

h4. Expectation
If an user attempts to edit a page that has an invalid date/time entry, the un-marshaller will fail. Instead of gracefully informing the user that there's a wrong entry somewhere, Confluence will display above stack trace and the editor will state that the server can't be contacted at that time. Users do expect a friendly message, like a banner in the top of the page, explaining that there's a problem with content while the stack trace above is logged in the backend.

h4. Other Bugs
This is similar to [CONFSERVER-33534|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-33534].
fields.summary: Invalid Date Time Format Error Message

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-29673]
{panel}
 

Summary

When the user makes a copy of some page with labeled attachments, these labels won't pass along with the attachments to the copied page.
When using a gallery macro, they won't show up these attachments, since they lost their tags.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the Attachments of a specific page;
 # Add labels to it;
 # On the specific page, click the {{...}} on the top right and select "Copy";
 # On the copied page, go to Attachments.

h3. Expected Results

The copied page will have attachments with labels as well as the original.
h3. Actual Results

No labels are shown on the copied page's attachments.
h3. Workaround

No workaround available at the moment.
fields.summary: Attachment's labels are not copied along with the page

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
If a Confluence instance cannot connect to http://confluence.atlassian.com, the log analyzer will not be able to run.

This means admins cannot use the log analyzer when they cannot connect due to...
* Mandatory firewall restrictions
* Network issues
* http://confluence.atlassian.com maintenance

h3. Suggested Solution
Two possible solutions:
* For instances blocked from http://confluence.atlassian.com: Allow a manual upload of the Confluence xml file the log analyzer uses to compare against the logs. This would allow users to download the file from the site, then manually add it to the environment to run the analyzer.
* For periods of confluence.atlassian.com maintenance or network issues: Have the log analyzer run using a previously downloaded version of the XML compare file.

h3. Why this is important
While network issues and site maintenance are rare, some organizations do have mandatory firewall restrictions. These organizations cannot use the log analyzer in their production instance.

h3. Workaround 
For instances that have mandatory firewall restrictions, you can copy the logs into a local trial instance to scan the logs:

# Install a trial version of Confluence on a local machine ([Installing a Confluence trial|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/installing-a-confluence-trial-838416249.html])
# While the trial instance is running, delete <confluence-home>/logs/atlassian-confluence.log from the trial instance.
# Replace the file with a copy of atlassian-confluence.log from your production environment.
_(Replacing this file while Confluence is running ensures irrelevant startup logs from your trial version won't be included)_
# Run the log analyzer.
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like to run the log analyzer, even if I cannot connect to https://confluence.atlassian.com

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Fetching data through the /answers REST resource does not return the expected results.

h3. Environment
* Tested with Questions for Confluence Plugin version 2.4.19

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Questions for Confluence plugin
# Include some sample questions and answers
# Run the follwoing command to retrieve answers data
{code}
curl -u <username>:<pass> -X GET 'http://bandreeti/confluence/rest/questions/1.0/answer?limit=10&start=0&username=<name>'
{code}

h3. Expected Results

The JSON dataset of the following document is returned:

* https://docs.atlassian.com/confluence-questions/rest/el_ns0_detailedAnswerDTO.html

h3. Actual Results

The following dataset is returned:

{code}
[{"id":8912944,"questionId":8912942,"author":{"name":"bandreeti","fullName":"Bernardo Andreeti","avatarDownloadPath":"/images/icons/profilepics/default.png","email":"bandreeti@bandreeti.com","userKey":"40288a045d190d23015d1957135d0001"},"dateAnswered":1506704076867,"friendlyDateAnswered":"less than a minute ago","votes":{"up":0,"down":1,"total":-1,"upVoted":false,"downVoted":false},"accepted":false,"space":{"spaceKey":"TEST","spaceName":"Test"},"url":"/display/TEST/questions/8912942/answers/8912944","question":{"id":8912942,"title":"another question","url":"/display/TEST/questions/8912942/another-question","author":{"name":"bandreeti","fullName":"Bernardo Andreeti","avatarDownloadPath":"/images/icons/profilepics/default.png","email":"bandreeti@bandreeti.com","userKey":"40288a045d190d23015d1957135d0001"},"friendlyDateAsked":"less than a minute ago","dateAsked":1506704066677,"answersCount":0,"topics":[{"id":9240577,"idAsString":"9240577","name":"ciastes","url":"/questions/topics/9240577/ciastes","featured":false,"isWatching":false}],"votes":{"up":1,"down":0,"total":1,"upVoted":true,"downVoted":false},"space":{"spaceKey":"TEST","spaceName":"Test"},"isTrashed":false},"idAsString":"8912944"},{"id":8912938,"questionId":8912936,"author":{"name":"bandreeti","fullName":"Bernardo Andreeti","avatarDownloadPath":"/images/icons/profilepics/default.png","email":"bandreeti@bandreeti.com","userKey":"40288a045d190d23015d1957135d0001"},"dateAnswered":1506704031820,"friendlyDateAnswered":"a minute ago","votes":{"up":1,"down":0,"total":1,"upVoted":false,"downVoted":false},"accepted":true,"dateAccepted":1506704048089,"space":{"spaceKey":"TEST","spaceName":"Test"},"url":"/display/TEST/questions/8912936/answers/8912938","question":{"id":8912936,"title":"this is a question","url":"/display/TEST/questions/8912936/this-is-a-question","author":{"name":"bandreeti","fullName":"Bernardo Andreeti","avatarDownloadPath":"/images/icons/profilepics/default.png","email":"bandreeti@bandreeti.com","userKey":"40288a045d190d23015d1957135d0001"},"friendlyDateAsked":"a minute ago","dateAsked":1506704026340,"answersCount":0,"topics":[{"id":6848513,"idAsString":"6848513","name":"bugs","url":"/questions/topics/6848513/bugs","featured":false,"isWatching":false}],"acceptedAnswerId":8912938,"votes":{"up":0,"down":0,"total":0,"upVoted":false,"downVoted":false},"space":{"spaceKey":"TEST","spaceName":"Test"},"isTrashed":false},"idAsString":"8912938"}]
{code}
 
h3. Notes

We can see that the *body* and *comments* data as described in the mentioned document are not present in the response, even though the answers have comments added to them. This means we cannot retrieve the contents of the answers (body) nor the comments through this mount point

h3.Workaround

Use the following mount point to retrieve answers data:

{code}
/rest/questions/1.0/answer/{answerId}
{code}

Notice that we need to specify the answer IDs with this call, so it may be necessary to create a script if all answers are needed.
fields.summary: Mount point /rest/questions/1.0/answer does not return the expected dataset

fields.description:
h3. Summary
As per the [Administering Collaborative Editing|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/administering-collaborative-editing-858772086.html] documentation, all existing shared drafts should be deleted upon disabling the Collaborative Editing feature.
{quote}
All existing shared drafts are lost when you switch to this mode, so make sure your users have published any work they want to keep before you make the change.
{quote}

h3. How to Reproduce
# Enable Collaborative Editing.
# Create a shared draft by inserting some texts on the title and the content space.
# Quit editing by closing the browser tab or save the draft by clicking the '_Close_' button at the bottom right of the editor and choose '_Keep Draft_'.
# Disable and reenable Collaborative Editing.

h3. Expected Behavior
Existing shared drafts should be deleted from the database.

h3. Actual Behavior
Existing shared drafts remain in the database. The following SQL query returns result(s).
{code:sql}SELECT * FROM CONTENT WHERE CONTENTTYPE = 'PAGE' AND CONTENT_STATUS = 'draft';{code}

h3. Workaround
# Discard the drafts via *Profile Picture* > *Drafts*.
Reference: https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/drafts-149040.html#Drafts-deleteDeleteadraft
# Remove all drafts from the database using the following SQL query.
{code:sql}DELETE FROM CONTENT WHERE CONTENTTYPE = 'PAGE' AND CONTENT_STATUS = 'draft';{code}
(!) It is important that you backup your data before performing any modifications to the database. Please test any {{INSERT}}, {{UPDATE}} or {{DELETE}} queries on a staging environment prior to rolling out changes onto production environment.
fields.summary: Disabling Collaborative Editing feature does not remove existing shared drafts
Limit acces per user

fields.description:
h2. Summary
The documentation for the [Code Block Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/code-block-macro-139390.html] mentions that additional languages can be added if they adhere to the custom brush syntax for [Syntax Highlighter|http://alexgorbatchev.com/SyntaxHighlighter/manual/brushes/custom.html]. However the brushes built from the newest version (v4) are not accepted by Confluence.

h2. Steps to reproduce
# Follow the build steps in [Syntax Highlighter|https://github.com/syntaxhighlighter/syntaxhighlighter/wiki/Building] to output a brush
# Attempt to upload the brush into Confluence via Confluence Admin > Configure Code Macro

h2. Expected behavior
A green box stating: "Successfully added the language".

h2. Actual behavior
A red box stating: "The uploaded language file is not a valid language definition. Consult the application log for further information."
(Note that nothing is actually logged in the application logs.)

h2. Other notes
SyntaxHighlighter v3 versions of the brushes seem to work in Confluence, while v4 does not. Details between the two can be found: https://github.com/syntaxhighlighter/syntaxhighlighter/wiki/Migration-Guide
fields.summary: Upgrade Confluence Code Macro to SyntaxHighlighter v4
Cache Content Page available and should be locked down

fields.description:
h4. Suggestion Description
We are currently able to import .XLSX files as a table in Confluence pages. However, tables are imported as they have been created, without formatting, and they doesn't allow you to sort content based on the table header.

h4. Steps to replicate
Just create a random .XLSX file and add it as a table to Confluence pages through the Excel Macro. If you do not format the file, it will be uploaded as it is:
!Screen Shot 2017-09-27 at 17.55.47.png|thumbnail! 

*Expectation:*
We would like to have the Excel Macro auto formatting the file:
!Screen Shot 2017-09-27 at 17.56.00.png|thumbnail! 

It is also only possible to sort column contents from A to Z or from Z to A through a plugin, the application native Macro doesn't do that.

h4. Workaround
Inserting the formatted table is currently possible through a [paid add-on|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/org.swift.confluence.table/server/overview] or you may manually format each of the .XLSX files manually in your local computer prior uploading it to Confluence.
fields.summary: Excel Macro - Automatically Format Tables

fields.description:
h4. Suggestion Description:
Currently, Confluence Excel Macro does not allow users to import and preview .CSV files, although this is a widely used file format. Although you can import .CSV files to a page, Preview doesn't work and neither does Excel Macro convert it to a table, as it does for .XLSX files. The expectation here is to modify the add-on so users can import, preview and append .CSV files as a table to Confluence pages.

h4. Preview of .CSV Files
*Expectation:* 
When we attach a .CSV file to a Confluence page, we expect it to provide us with a Preview, as it does for regular .XLSX files.

*Reality:*
# Preview doesn't Work:
!Screen Shot 2017-09-27 at 17.38.27.png|thumbnail!
# It also doesn't work when you click on it:
!Screen Shot 2017-09-27 at 17.38.34.png|thumbnail!

h4. Excel Macro
*Expectation:* 
# We can use the Excel Macro to convert .CSV files to a table in Confluence pages, which would be the same feature already available for .XLSX files.
!Screen Shot 2017-09-27 at 17.36.31.png|thumbnail! 
# Table:
!Screen Shot 2017-09-27 at 17.40.38.png|thumbnail! 

*Reality:*
.CSV Files are not allowed by the Excel Macro.
!Screen Shot 2017-09-27 at 17.36.41.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Excel Macro - Allow CSV Files

fields.description:
Summary

Space directory search filters fails with underscore

Environment
Confluence version : 5.10.x and I was able to reproduce on 6.1.3.
No plugins no proxy used no SSL

Browser versions:
•  All 3 browsers are affected 

Steps to Reproduce
1.	Log in to confluence
2.	Navigate to space directories when searching with space name that contains _ nothing is found
3.	Tested with dash and results were showing
Screen shots showing: 
 1.full list of spaces
 2. result of underscore- not showing output
 3. result with dash filter- showing output
Expected Results
To have results similar to dash
fields.summary: Underscore prevents search in space directory

fields.description:
"Unknown error" when replying to deleted comment via Workbox

h5. Step to reproduce:
# Create a new page as User B
# Leave a comment as User A.
# Open the page as User B and delete the comment by User A
# Open Workbox as User B
# Reply to the deleted comment as User B

h5. Expected Behavior
Any proper indicator to notify user that comment has been deleted

h5. Actual Behavior
"Unknow error" shown
fields.summary: Workbox - improper error handling when replying to deleted comment

fields.description:
Features required include:

Creating the newsletter in a page in Confluence
Selecting the distribution group / audience (will have to be internal people or groups that are in our LDAP instance)
Option to display the newsletter as HTML or plain text in the recipient's email inbox
Having a link in the email back to the confluence page in the instance it is not displaying correctly
If there are statistics that can be generated by the number of people that open the newsletter or click on links in the newsletter that would be an added bonus.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using the Include Page Macro, clicking on *Go to Included Page* the page opens up a new window but throws *HTTP 400 Bad request*.

h3. Environment
 * Internet Explorer 11
 * Confluence page title with UTF characters ( Eg: Korean, Chinese or Japanese)

h3. Steps to Reproduce (use Internet Explorer)
 # Create a Page with title as Page1
 # Create another Page with Title using UTF8 characters ( eg: 这是中国 )
 # On Page1, use Include Page Macro and link it to page 这是中国 (created in step 2)
 # In the Page1 editor, click on Include Page Macro then Go to Included Page
 # This opens up a new browser and throws the HTTP 400 error

h3. Expected Results
 # The page should open up without any errors

h3. Actual Results
The included page opens up in a new browser window with a 400 Error.

h3. Workaround
This works in Chrome and Firefox without issue
fields.summary: Include Page Macro throws Error when clicking in Go to Include page using Internet Explorer with UTF characters

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Confluence does not allow the creation of users with upper-case characters in the username, but it does allow syncing upper-cased usernames from external LDAPs. A Page Properties Report macro with a "Mentioning User" filter will not work if the filter mentions upper-cased usernames. 

h3. Environment
Confluence integrated with any external LDAP containing upper-cased usernames.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Integrate Confluence with any external LDAP containing the following usernames:
** user1
** USER2
* Create "PageA" and add a label named "mylabel" to the page
* Add a Page Properties macro in PageA with the following properties
** MyProperty = Value1
** Owner = (\@ mention user1)
* Create "PageB" and add a label named "mylabel" to the page
* Add a Page Properties macro in PageB with the following properties
** MyProperty = Value2
** Owner = (\@ mention USER2)
* Create "PPRM page"
* Add a Page Properties Report macro and configure it as follows:
** label = mylabel
** Space = Current Space
** Add a filter >>> Mentioning User >>> user1
* Add another Page Properties Report macro and configure it as follows:
** label = mylabel
** Space = Current Space
** Add a filter >>> Mentioning User >>> USER2

h3. Expected Results

Both PPR macros should be populated with the respective pages.

h3. Actual Results

Only the PPR macro filtered by "user1" is properly populated.

h3.Workaround

1. Download and install [Confluence Source Editor|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.editor.confluence-source-editor/server/overview] in your instance
2. Enter the page containing the PPR macro in Edit mode
3. Click the "<>" icon in the top-right corner of the screen
4. Find the pieces of code containing upper-cased usernames. For an example, considering that there's an filter pointing to the username "PTA54014":

{code}
<ac:parameter ac:name="cql">label = "cost-of-care" and space = "PDL" and mention = "PTA54014"</ac:parameter>
{code}

5. Replace them with the respective lower-cased characters. Example:

{code}
<ac:parameter ac:name="cql">label = "cost-of-care" and space = "PDL" and mention = "pta54014"</ac:parameter>
{code}

6. Save the page

Please note, once the PPR macro is changed through the UI, this workaround must be re-applied.
fields.summary: Page Properties Report macro with "Mentioning User" filter does not work with upper-cased usernames

fields.description:
Steps to replicate :
 # Start Confluence setup wizard
 # Input your Confluence license and click next
 # Choose "My own database" and click next
 # Select MySQL as Database type and click next
 # Click on Direct JDBC
 # Notice that the suggestion says to append &useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=utf8 if using non-latin characters.
 # Append the following to add unicode support as mentioned on the page :
{code:java}
&useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=utf8{code}

 # Input your database User Name and Password then click next

*Current Behavior :* You will get the following error as per the screenshot below :
 !mysqlError.jpg|thumbnail!

*Expected Behavior :* The error is expected when the url is not structured correctly. If the url does not already contain a query string, it will fail as above.

*Workaround* : If the url does not contain a query string already (beginning with ?), then you need to add the following, instead:
{code:java}
?useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=utf8{code}

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using "calligraphic languages" (tested with Sinhala, Arabic, and Tamil) characters are not properly connected/merged in PDF export. And "combined/merged characters" (2 close characters form 3rd character) are not displayed correctly. In case when all characters needs to be connected, they are exported as separate characters.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create page with this content: වහල් මෙහෙය මනුෂ්‍යත්වයට තරම් නොවන, ඉතා අශිෂ්ට
#  !page.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
# When page is exported to PDF you should see the same text: වහල් මෙහෙය මනුෂ්‍යත්වයට තරම් නොවන, ඉතා අශිෂ්ට

h3. Actual Results
Characters will be separated and text will be unreadable.
 !pdf.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
During the testing for PDF export font  [^iskpota.ttf] was used.

h3.Workaround
Use Word export as the issue is not present with Word
fields.summary: PDF export will not properly merge/concatenate characters.

fields.description:
Hello,

Summary:

The Web Server embedded in Confluence's Synchrony web server (Vertx/Netty?) seems to have a default http header size limit of 8k.

This breaks Collaborative Editing for users signing in with Kerberos SSO if they are also member of a lot of Active Directory groups.

Proposed solution:

Synchrony should either increase the default header size limit to 32k, or at least make the default value con figurable.

Background:

On Windows, Kerberos tickets will include information about group membership

When a user is a member of an unusual number of groups (say 200), the encoded Kerberos ticket may grow larger than the maximum size allowed by default in Netty.

According to the following Netty Javadoc:

[http://netty.io/4.0/api/io/netty/handler/codec/http/HttpRequestDecoder.html]

Netty by default has a limit of 8k for headers.

We've seen large enterprise customers who could not use Collaborative Editing because of this problem.

We have updated our recommended Apache and Nginx config to remove any "Authorization:" headers for /synchrony paths.

However, since people don't read documentation, we would much prefer if Atlassian could simply increase the header size limit from 8k to 32k. 32k translates to 32768 bytes.

Eirik.
fields.summary: Increase max HTTP header size in Confluence Synchrony web server

h3. Problem Definition
Workbox notifications build up globally in the database and are not easily administrated and removed. This can lead to build up in the database tables that cause performance slow downs.

Add options to clear notifications from before a certain date automatically.

h3. Notes
When performing the same {{ban*a}} search in the Groups panel (General Config > Groups) we receive an error noting that two wildcards are automatically included at the beginning and the end of the default search. It appears because these wildcards are already in place they cannot be used in the middle of a phrase when searching a group.

{code}
The following error(s) occurred:
Constructing search for groups failed: You may only use two wildcards to wrap the search term - e.g. *smith*. Your term was: *ban*a*
{code}

h3. Workaround
Refine search to only utilize and asterisk at the beginning and/or the end of the search phrase rather than in the middle.
fields.summary: Unable to use wildcard in the middle of a phrase in group search

fields.description:
We sometimes add links to tasks. These links are often still of interest when a task is checked off. However, once a task is marked as done, the entire task text (including the links) get greyed-out. That way, we can't see that the task has a link.

It would be great if links kept their original color after tasks are marked as done, so we could still see the links.
fields.summary: Don't grey out links in tasks when task is checked off

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, if a Confluence admin wants to audit space permissions they can go to the Space Permissions section of the Confluence Administration panel for a list of spaces, but there is no way to tell if spaces have permission schemes that don't match the Global Space Permissions. This means an admin needs to go through every space to see what permissions they have.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add some kind of indicator badge to space names in the list to identify spaces with permission schemes that don't match the Global Space Permissions.
fields.summary: Identify Spaces that have permissions that don't match the global space permissions

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
If a user wants to email a file attached to a Confluence page, they must save the attachment to their computer and then attach it to an email. Confluence can "share" attachments by linking to them in Confluence, but this wouldn't work if the file needs to get sent to someone that doesn't have access to Confluence.

h3. Suggested Solution
Confluence should have the ability to either send the actual attachment via email, or allow a user to drag/drop a file from Confluence into an email client like Outlook.
fields.summary: Allow Confluence to send attachments via email

fields.description: It would be a nice feature to provide the ability for confluence admin's with a recycle bin kind of feature. space once deleted will stay in recycle bin for 30 days or so before getting purged. This way the heavy lifting of bring the space from backups can be avoided.
fields.summary: Send deleted space to a "bin" that can be restored by Administrators

fields.description:
*Problem Statement:*
According to the [UPM Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/universal-plugin-manager-stops-working-after-upgrading-it-to-version-2-7-or-greater-313465169.html], for version 2.7 or greater of the plugin manager, NTLM Authentication is not supported and may bring issues to customers who use it. One of them is the challenge to access the Atlassian Marketplace through the UPM to browse add-ons, which can be a big show-stopper for customers who intend to purchase add-ons and use them to do their duties.

*Workaround:*
The only known workaround is to implement [CNTLM|http://cntlm.sourceforge.net/] in between the application and the NTLM Proxy, which is a component that adds the needed authentication on the fly so the connection does not hang at a Proxy level.

*Expected Behaviour:*
To be able to use NTLM Authentication in a Proxy level and have UPM working as well.

*Current Behaviour:*
UPM does not allow you to browse add-ons and neither update your current ones. In the logs, we can see the following entry:
{code:java}
2017-08-10 18:31:27,767 ERROR [lifecycle:thread-1] [sal.core.upgrade.PluginUpgrader] doUpgrade Upgrade failed: org/ietf/jgss/GSSException
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/ietf/jgss/GSSException
    at org.apache.http.impl.auth.SPNegoSchemeFactory.create(SPNegoSchemeFactory.java:66)
    at org.apache.http.impl.client.AuthenticationStrategyImpl.select(AuthenticationStrategyImpl.java:175)
    at org.apache.http.impl.client.ProxyAuthenticationStrategy.select(ProxyAuthenticationStrategy.java:43)
    at org.apache.http.impl.auth.HttpAuthenticator.handleAuthChallenge(HttpAuthenticator.java:154)
...
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.ietf.jgss.GSSException not found by com.atlassian.upm.atlassian-universal-plugin-manager-plugin [228]
    at org.apache.felix.framework.BundleWiringImpl.findClassOrResourceByDelegation(BundleWiringImpl.java:1532)
    at org.apache.felix.framework.BundleWiringImpl.access$400(BundleWiringImpl.java:75)
    at org.apache.felix.framework.BundleWiringImpl$BundleClassLoader.loadClass(BundleWiringImpl.java:1955)
    at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:357)
    ... 98 more
{code}

*Previous Bugs:*
This has already been flagged to development through [UPM-1104|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/UPM-1104] and [UPM-2855|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/UPM-2855], but was flagged as won't fix by that time. As these bugs are old (2012) and there's still the need of implementing a solution for this, it would be interesting to review what can be done to make this available for customers.

*Suggestion:*
If possible, shipping [CNTLM|http://cntlm.sourceforge.net/] along with Confluence would be a great solution.
fields.summary: Provide Support for Proxies using NTLM Authentication

fields.description:
It'll be great if admins can get a form of notification should a user directory that Confluence is connected to suddenly stops synchronizing, which could be caused by user directories are unreachable.

This will be great for incident management as it will be detected by the application first.
fields.summary: A form of notification should user directories failed to synchronize

fields.description:
I often see the demand to visually highlight a specific piece of code within a code block macro.

The reason is usually to point-out or explain a details in the context of a longer section of code. That could be a parameter that needs to be adjusted, an important line of code within a larger block or a method-call that is subject to discussion.

Common use cases:
 * systems / software documentation, e.g. descriptions of properties-files where certain parameters need adjustment
 * best-practices documentation with code samples, in which specific details need to be pointed out
 * code-quality discussion (e.g. referring to JIRA tickets) in which a reviewer wants to point out a mistake or something else in a code snippet while preserving context
 * installation guides in which commands or their parameters need to be adjusted and hence be explained

I envision the result to look something like the mockup I have attached.

IMHO a macro within a macro could do the trick; something like:

\{code:lang=xyz}
 line 1
 line 2
 line 3 \{code-highlight}with highlighted details\{code-highlight}
 line4
 \{code}

For reference, I found two related issues (however without specific use cases or closed) and a forum discussion about this:

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37494

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-1571

[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-questions/Highlighting-code-within-a-code-block/qaq-p/20181]

 Edit: This might also be related:

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-1179
fields.summary: Highlight (visually) a specific piece of code in a code block

fields.description: We would like to disallow a single user ID from being used for concurrent logins and any attempt to create a concurrent login would create a notification to the system admin or any pre-defined party
fields.summary: Disallow a single user ID from being used for concurrent logins

fields.description:
h3. Description
When importing a word documentation that has / in the heading and split it to a new page for every heading. Confluence will replace the / to _ for the page title.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Open a page
# Go to tool >> Import word documentation
# Upload a word file that has / in the heading
# Select the option to split the heading
# Click import
# You will notice the page title with / is replaced to _
(i) For details, you may review the following video
 [^Recording #32.mp4] 

*Expected Result*
THe page title is imported as specified in the word document

*Actual Result*
THe confluence replaced the / to _
fields.summary: Confluence replace / to _ when importing a word document that contains / in the heading

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Mentioning user didn't work when creating a new question.
It worked when editing a question, answering to a question and commenting on a question as expected.

h3. Environment

* Questions for Confluence 2.4.19

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Open create question screen
# Mention any user in the editor (e.g. Type "@Test User")
# Press _Save_ button

h3. Expected Results

The user should be mentioned.

h3. Actual Results

The user was not mentioned and it was shown as just a link for the user profile. (The notification wasn't sent to the user.)

 !create_question.png|thumbnail! 

If you edit the question and mention the user in the description, the user is mentioned as expected.

 !edit_question.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

* This problem didn't seem to happen on Questions for Confluence 2.4.15

h3.Workaround

There is no workaround.
fields.summary: Mentioning user didn't work when creating new question

fields.description:
h3. Summary

*Attachment Macro* does not show warning message when user upload attachment bigger than limited maximum size via the _Browse for files_ method

h3. Environment
Confluence 6.4.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to !https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/files/590259974/590058056/1/1398739558493/Cog.png! > *General Configuration* > *Attachment Settings* > click _Edit_
# Set the _Attachment Maximum Size_ to a lower number for testing purpose (It is 100MB by default). In my case, I set it to 5MB.
# Create a new page and add in *Attachment Macro* with all default parameters and Save the page.
# When viewing the page, click on the _Browse for files_ in the Attachment Macro and select a file that is larger than the set limit. In my case, I try to upload a 8MB file

h3. Expected Results
A warning message will be displayed to warn user about the maximum attachment size is 5MB
 !Attachment Macro Warning Message.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The file is not uploaded, but no error message is displayed
The attached video compares 2 different ways of uploading an attachment larger than set limit:
 [^Attachment Macro Bug.mp4] 

h3. Workaround
* Upload using Drag & Drop method will show the warning message correctly.
* Upload using _Files and images_ from the macro menu during edit will also show the warning message correctly.
fields.summary: Attachment Macro does not show warning message when user upload attachment bigger than limited maximum size

If a gadget is configured, and the URL could not be connected due to timeout or other reason, the macro browser will return error like 'Failed to get macro details', as a result of that, the panel is not usable as no meta info of macros are returned.

fields.description:
While tasks play a huge role in Confluence, enabling us to assign, time, notify and track their progress, it would be great if we could integrate Confluence with Trello and automatically create cards in a board when a new task is created in Confluence.

All the tasks details could be sent to Trello equivalent fields:
 * Status (checked/not checked)
 * @assignee
 * //deadline
 * description
 * page where the task was created
fields.summary: Enable Confluence tasks to be created in a Trello board instead of having them in Confluence only

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a user clicks a link to a Confluence page that includes a query string (for example, if they are linked directly to an attachment preview) but is not logged in, the redirect URL will not include the query string. Instead of seeing a preview of the attachment just the page will be displayed. 

If a page has multiple attachments, it can then be difficult to find the attachment they were linked to originally (or they have to click the link again). 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add an attachment to a page
# Preview the attachment and copy the resulting URL, for example:
{code}http://localhost:8090/display/TEST/Attachment+preview+test?preview=/327693/327699/test.jpg{code}
# Log out of Confluence
# Paste the URL in your address bar and hit enter
# Login to Confluence after being redirected to login.action

h3. Expected Results
After authenticating, the user is redirected to the original URL. In this case it would be 
{code:borderStyle=solid}
http://localhost:8090/display/TEST/Attachment+preview+test?preview=/327693/327699/unl.jpg
{code}
The attachment is opened in the previewer

h3. Actual Results
After authenticating, the user is redirected to the original URL but without the query string on the end.
{code:borderStyle=solid}
http://localhost:8090/display/TEST/Attachment+preview+test
{code}
The user only sees the original page. You can see this in action at [^Screen Recording 2017-09-21 at 18.41.49.mov]

h3. Notes
This is even more confusing for customers with SSO, as they aren't shown the login page. They click the link, and the page loads but no attachment preview is shown. It just looks like Confluence sometimes doesn't render the preview.
fields.summary: Login page strips some query strings from redirect URL
Use hostnames be used instead of IP addresses in Confluence/Synchrony config files

fields.description:
h3. Summary
IE 11 is not replacing double quotes (" ") to *%22* while opening a link in the *Macro Usage* page. This functionality works with Chrome properly.

In the end, Confluence won't be able to display all the pages that have a specific macro tied to the body of the page.

h3. Environment

* Confluence 6.3.1
* IE 11  11.0.9600.18665

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the *Macro Usage* page(IE11).
# Click on any link to open in a new tab

h3. Expected Results

Confluence will open the search page(/dosearchsite.action) showing all the pages using the specific macro.

h3. Actual Results

A page not found will be displayed.
 
h3. Notes
{code:title=URL IE 11}
http://localhost:8090/dosearchsite.action?cql=macro+%3D+"jira"
{code}
{code:title=URL Google Chrome}
http://localhost:8090/dosearchsite.action?cql=macro+%3D+%22jira%22
{code}

h3.Workaround
Use another browser.
fields.summary: Can't open links in the Macro Usage page with IE 11
Desktop view will not resize Keyboard Shortcuts modal for viewports smaller than height/width

fields.description:
h6. Summary

The {{service.bat}} file that's used for creating the Windows service for Confluence sets different Java options than the {{setenv.bat}} file:

*Options in common*
{code:java}
-XX:+UseG1GC
-XX:-PrintGCDetails
-XX:-PrintTenuringDistribution
-XX:+UseGCLogFileRotation
-XX:NumberOfGCLogFiles=5
-XX:GCLogFileSize=2M
-Xloggc:%CATALINA_HOME%/logs/gc-%%t.log
-Djava.awt.headless=true
-Datlassian.plugins.enable.wait=300
{code}
*Options set by {{service.bat}}*
{code:java}
-Dcatalina.home=%CATALINA_HOME%
-XX:+PrintGCTimeStamps
-Dcatalina.base=%CATALINA_BASE%
-Djava.endorsed.dirs=%CATALINA_HOME%\endorsed
-Djava.io.tmpdir=%CATALINA_BASE%\temp
-Djava.util.logging.manager=org.apache.juli.ClassLoaderLogManager
-Djava.util.logging.config.file=%CATALINA_BASE%\conf\logging.properties
{code}
*Options set by {{setenv.bat}}*
{code:java}
-XX:+PrintGCDateStamps 
-XX:G1ReservePercent=20
-Xms1024m 
-Xmx1024m 
-Dsynchrony.enable.xhr.fallback=true
-Dorg.apache.tomcat.websocket.DEFAULT_BUFFER_SIZE=32768
%START_CONFLUENCE_JAVA_OPTS%
-Dconfluence.context.path=%CONFLUENCE_CONTEXT_PATH%
{code}
The START_CONFLUENCE_JAVA_OPTIONS set in {{setenv.bat}} is probably not needed in {{service.bat}} since it's used for starting Confluence in safe mode, but the ones relating to Synchrony should be included in {{service.bat}}.

{panel:title=Note|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5|titleBGColor=#3C78B5|bgColor=#E7F4FA}
We've undertaken some work to improve on this issue in 7.12.0.

The {{service.bat}} file now implements all of the same configurations as the {{setenv.sh}} and {{setenv.bat}} files, except for 
* Differences required by starting as a service (/)
* Java 11 GC settings which are overridden in part by Java 8 settings (!) - I've opened a bug to track this at [CONFSERVER\-61415: Java 11 Garbage Collection Logging Settings Are Not Correctly Applied on Confluence Start|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-61415] as I was unable to resolve this prior to the release of 7.12.0.

So with the release of 7.12.0, most of this issue is fixed, but there's some more to go. We additionally want to look at having the {{service.bat}} file inherit its configuration from {{setenv.bat}} to simplify the process of installing Confluence on Windows.

Hopefully this helps in the interim.
{panel}
fields.summary: Service.sh and setenv.bat files set different Java options

fields.description:
Summary:
Copying text in huge table takes more time than usual. The slowness starting to appear copying text into row #500 and above.

h5. Step to reproduce:
# Fresh install Confluence 6.2.4
# Copy the Storage Format in a page
# Start copying the date/text into new row in the huge table


h5. Expected Behavior
# No slowness will appear between the moment you push the CTRL + V and the moment of copied text appears in the table.

h5. Actual Behavior
# Slowness will appear between the moment you push the CTRL + V and the moment of copied text appears in the table
 [^6.2.4.mp4] 

h5. Resolution
Tested out on 6.3.4 and it looks like the issue resolved in this version. 
 [^6.3.4.mp4]
fields.summary: Copy text in huge table(couple hundred rows) take more time than usual

fields.description:
I would like to suggest below improvements to confluence copy page hierarchy feature, so that it could be more effective and efficient. 

1. Add suffixes to page titles
2. Deselect pages from page tree from coping/deleting 
3. Ability to change titles page wise in copy page hierarchy window. 
4. Replace content inside pages of the tree (replace function via copy page hierarchy window)
5. Pick a specific version of the document for the whole tree. Eg. If page and subpages have multiple versions, copy will copy only one version for page and all subpages.

Please refer the image attached

Use case for this feature copy hierarchy feature is to be compatible with page version management plugins. More details in  [^copy page hierarchy_FeatureReq_Usecase.docx]
fields.summary: Improve Copy Page Efficiency and Effectiveness
